title: 2026 Mobo Awards: Nominations Highlight Black Music Excellence
summary: The 2026 Mobo awards nominations have been announced, with Olivia Dean and Little Simz leading with four nominations each. Olivia Dean's album The Art Of Loving is up for album of the year, while Little Simz's Lotus continues her successful streak despite recent challenges. Other notable nominees include Central Cee, PinkPantheress, Skepta, Flo, and newcomers Kwn and Jim Legxacy, who are gaining recognition. The ceremony will take place in Manchester on March 26, marking the 30th anniversary of the Mobo organization, founded by Kanya King in 1996 to champion music of black origin. King emphasizes that Mobo awards have historically fueled artists' careers, as seen with past winners like Stormzy and Dave. Little Simz is nominated in categories such as best female and best hip-hop act, and Olivia Dean for best soul act and song of the year. Jim Legxacy, a rising star, has four nominations including video and song of the year, and KWN, a breakout R&B singer, is nominated for best newcomer and other awards after a viral hit in 2025. This event underscores the ongoing support for black music talent in the UK.

background_read: The Mobo awards, founded by Kanya King in 1996, are a key event in the UK music scene, dedicated to promoting black music. Over 30 years, they have launched careers of artists like Stormzy and Dave. The 2026 nominations highlight both established stars like Olivia Dean and Little Simz, and emerging talents such as Jim Legxacy and KWN, reflecting the organization's role in fostering diversity and recognition in the industry. This anniversary edition in Manchester underscores its enduring impact.
